Reviews.Title: “Served a purpose”
Reviews.Author: RV4Pilot
Reviews.Content: We booked the Belgravia Mews Hotel via Late Rooms so we could meet up with family prior to flying out on holiday. We were very pushed for time. The room was reduced from £600-ish per night to £80 including breakfast as part of the deal hence we booked. Seemed like a very good deal however – key points for us were: Reception is located the Hotel next door where we were met by efficient staff and the adjoining restaurant seemed very to be very popular. We were shown to our room about 50m down the street. The first thing about the room was the overpowering stale smell and badly stained carpet in the room. The bed appeared to be clean. The tap in the bathroom (small wet room cubicle) was broken and got sprayed by the shower (no way of tuning it off) The light in bathroom flickered on and off and was partly hanging off its mounting (safety hazard?) What furniture / room fittings there were were broken Walls were marked stained as was the paintwork Big damp / mildew patch on the ceiling Door handle on the outside of the room was loose. I had to screw it back on my my fingers to stop it coming off in my hand We had a very early start and so did not bother with breakfast On the plus side: Location is good, about 200m from Victoria stations (bus / rail / tube) The bed was clean and did provide a good nights sleep This isn't the best deal we've had from late rooms. It is difficult to see how the original price shown when we booked could be justified. Would not recommend this hotel and will not be using it again.

Reviews.Title: “More luck than judgement”
Reviews.Author: rakeevil
Reviews.Content: Difficult review this one as we booked this hotel up hurriedly on the way to London staying that night via late rooms then read the reviews. Oh dear we thought and started to panic rang late rooms back up to say hopefully we could cancel due to the negative reviews they have had. Lateroom's got straight onto the case but called back five minutes later to ask that the manager was not in until tomorrow so we MAY end up paying even if we didn't stay. So I blamed the poor old husband and he took the ear bashing. We went and had a great day out then decided to check in to see what we had let ourselves in for. Firstly we arrived to see a notice on the front door to check in at Tophams Hotel no 28 instead of No 50 which annoyed me as we had walked back and lets face was this place was never going to stand a chance especially as when we walked into Tophams what a lovely bright, clean and shiny reception, so we negatively checked in for Belgravia Mews then to be told that Tophams was not fully booked so they had upgraded us to for the same price, I honestly saw my husband's shoulders lift about a foot with relief so went happily to our room No 4 which was in the basement opened the door and got a really pleasant surprise considering what we thought we would be getting!! then on closer inspection...... there was a really bad odour of damp/drains in the room, the shower lights were not working, a HUGH bath but the shower attachment would only work with the bath taps on, sealing and grouting missing in the bathroom, chips on the woodwork and the carpet could have done with a good clean, the mattress was so soft you sunk in the middle and then the air conditioning seemed to have a mind of its own. However remember we got this at a bargain price of £62.16 including breakfast so should we be complaining probably not! The next morning we remember the clonking noise as people walked through the reception area above but we had things to do so didn’t want a lay in (good job really). We also then noticed no milk or English tea in the hospitality tray so ventured to breakfast. English breakfast luckily for us was included in the price although again I think this was because we had been upgraded as I heard someone enquire if they could have a cooked breakfast. The waitress obviously says yes but it was £19.95, thank goodness she declined. The breakfast was buffet style and when I got there they had run out of eggs and bacon, the rest was all being kept warm under not very efficient chaffing tins. The Danish pastries were excellent though so probably best to stick to continental breakfast. Summary: We did well in the end for £62.16 in the middle of London and were grateful for the upgrade despite the maintenance issues. The reason why I am publishing this on both hotels is to warn others not to pay TOO much for the Topham’s hotel as it does have its downfalls and perhaps try and get an upgrade if you are staying at Belgravia Mews which we could not fault as we did not stay there. All staff were polite but when we pointed out the smell issue not much notice was taken so overall ok but wouldn’t pay over the top for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Falwty towers without the humour.”
Reviews.Author: breen9
Reviews.Content: arrived no room available, said they would find another then couldn't find key, staff all seemed very confused and pissed off with one another.Eventually after an hour and a half they said our room was ready, led us outside the building down the st 2 a dingy dirty room, no main light working got stuck in bathroom, handle coming off the door. Coming home late that night main door 2 building left opened, next morning no running water , no phone in the room, no fire exit 2 b seen. Highlighted these issues they ave given us a alot nicer room, ok at presemt, staff seem annoyed at complaints but they must b used 2 it i wouldn't let my dog slefp here

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely shocking!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: haggied
Reviews.Content: Nothing good to say about this place. Honestly the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Would have been better sleeping on the street. The list goes on and on about what was wrong with this place; Broken toliet - did not flush No bin in main room Phone in room was not connected Room wifi did not work/was not on No information pack Ripped carpet Wallpaper hanging off Chipped paint and ripped carpets in hallway/stairs Dirty bed sheets!!!! Dirty Curtains No extra pillows Smelled It really was as bad as it sounds. Currently trying to get money back but complaint not acknowledged. Now had no get other people involved to resolve the issue. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Weird place - can be a bargain, but... it seems to be about luck.”
Reviews.Author: GenerallyWandering
Reviews.Content: Didn't read the reviews before... And I must say my stay was acceptable at the rate I got the hotel for. It might be down to luck - or appearance? The room I got was no worse than other cheap london "4-stars" (this is London after all). Not at all boutique - but not the horror described. As the rate was the same as a 2* I can't say I'm unhappy about it, and the location is brilliant. If I knew I'd get the same room again I would recommend it or go back. But as it seems to be something of a lottery, I'm not keen on recommending the place... As people noted, it seems to be a hostel being renovated, and not at all an hotel. (When I was there the whole hotel seemed to be shut down except the top floor or two?). Either that or a scam. But then, why would Topham put their reputation at risk? Weird... an explanation for this "hotel" would sure be interesting...

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: totallylovelasvegas
Reviews.Content: I dont normally write reviews but I do feel the need to review this place...I work as a therapist in a hotel myself and I've been lucky enough to have stayed in some of the most luxury hotels around the world (granted ive stayed in cheapo ones too) soooo i was initially very worried about staying here as we'd booked without reading reviews first. Me and mum booked it as my dad was paying for us to go shopping and see some shows in london. Well, I had a very pleasant surprise! The hotel is in a fab location near victoria station and close proximity to to lots of attractions. Our room (mews 3) was lovely and clean, modern, with an oversized bath and walk in shower, nice telly, tea and coffee making facilities, complimentary safe and a fridge. The staff were lovely and very helpful at all times. Maybe we were just lucky? But sometimes its just a case of treating others as you would wish to be treated yourself.. if you want a clean and friendly place to stay for a good rate in london, then dont be put off by negative reviews and book :0)

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever London Stay”
Reviews.Author: Paul_from_pont
Reviews.Content: Firstly you arrive at the door only to find a sign to tell you to go down the street to check-in. I was shown to a room with only one working light (a 40w bedside light) and that was not bright enough to see around the room. I then walked back to reception down the street for a room change. A brighter room this time, but the light only highlighted the filthy state of the carpets and the smell of mould was pungent. Noise from other rooms was dreadful - 3 entrance doors were next to each other and it sounded like someone was trying to get into your room (at mignight, 2am and 6am). But saving the worst to last, halfway through my shower the water went off and there was no water in either the shower or the taps. A mere apology at reception and a note in their book, no thought to offering me the opportunity of finishing my shower in another room - they were just happy to let me go on with my day without thought of offering me anything in return. Overall my worst stay in London in a long time. I shall have this hotel removed from our corportate booking site.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but that's all”
Reviews.Author: sharon j
Reviews.Content: Great location but that is all to expect. This hotel was scruffy smelt of damp . We were put up the very top of this hotel with lots of stairs and we felt like we were in the staff quarters , bless them it was like a bedsit ,first room no water ,so we asked to be moved ,but it was suggested we could use the shower in another room that was right down the bottom of the stairs about 4 sets . I DONT THINK SO . we were then put in a room with a shower which seemed like to be in a cupboard ,broken tap ,had to fiddle with the tap to make it work ,also dripped all night .the place stank of damp ,and very scruffy ,oh yes tea and coffee in room but no cartons of milk ,so we asked but you would of thought we had asked for something very strange , but then it was a very strange place !

Reviews.Title: “London should be ashamed saying this is 3 star!!?!”
Reviews.Author: Stygian
Reviews.Content: Arrived & had Â£30 pre-authorised on my card despite being taken to an awful room 4 flights up with no elevator & no telephone/ "room service" which is what the pre-authorisation was supposedly for. My room stinks & is FILTHY - only here for one night but very worried I'll be travelling with bed-bugs from here :-(

Reviews.Title: “I wish I had read trip advisor before booking this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kirsty578
Reviews.Content: Had a weekend in London for my birthday and to attend the opera at Covent Garden. Dropped cases at hotel, couldn't get into room, fair enough as it was just after midday so couldn't put on my new outfit .Changed top in the only toilet in Tophams, who presumably act as agents for this dodgy doss house. Returned after the opera and dinner about 11.45pm, suprised to be escorted several doors up the street and led into a gloomy house, property next door under refurbishment, covered in plastic tarpaulin, up 3 flights of stairs quality of carpets and decor deteriorating with each flight of stairs. Room... a cowboy builder has done a dreadful job of converting this room into an en suite, decor naff, bleach stains on the carpet by the bathroom door,no chair, no bin, no hair dryer, shower ...didn't drain, quality of fittings something bought from a car boot. Slats on bed came apart. On leaving the room the following morning it struck me ,where is the fire exit? I am usually obsessive about this but after a long hactic day didn't think to check. This accomodation is only suitable for backpackers but not at this price! A premier inn would have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Find Somewhere Better”
Reviews.Author: R L
Reviews.Content: This was described as a four star hotel. One star would be generous. The hallway was smelly. My room was tiny and very dark. I have seen bigger bathrooms on planes. It was like a pod that had been stuck in a corner of the room. There are no staff on the premises. They are all at Tophams Hotel a few doors down the street. Even at discount rates this was terrible value for money. London is expensive but you can do much better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Death trap”
Reviews.Author: pmork
Reviews.Content: I'm a pretty seasoned traveler and do 1-2 trips a month. Generally stay only at hilton hotels as I have a platinum card with them. Hilton was fully booked this time and expensive so I randomly chose this place given it's location. What a mistake. My first room was in the basement. Dark, old furniture, stains (don't ask!). Really felt like a cave rather then a room. To make matters worse the bathroom and shower were so small it was like taking a shower in a closet. The ceiling was barely inches over my head and the light sockets weren't properly built into it so i was at risk of electrocuting myself every time i touched my head! To make matters worse they hadn't replaced one of the shower doors so I had to do some fancy gymnastics to avoid getting water all over the floor..... After one night I requested a room change fearing for my life. The 2nd room was on the 3rd floor. The room was so small I nearly tripped over the bed as I walked in. The AC was broken so sleeping was really challenging given the July heat. Decoration was pretty humorous. For example even though I had a double bed, the headboard was actually built for a single :( and I had not 1 or 2 nightstands but 3!! It was like they had randomly thrown all their favorite auntie's furniture into the single,smallest room they could find. Ah, and the lovely bathroom. Well at least it wasn't an electric chair but it was communal so I had to share it with the rest of the floor. nice ;) anyway, shame on me for not reading TA first. This place is one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed at. avoid at all costs. P

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish...”
Reviews.Author: Chuck_Wagon_UK
Reviews.Content: Didn't provide the rooms we were promised so I ended up having to ask for sheets and duvet to make a put-you-up bed on the floor. Toilet seat was broken. Shower trickled water and made a horrendous noise. Light switch didn't work. Door lock was difficult to turn. Carpets badly stained. Breakfast up the street in another location. Dining room cramped to the point of having to move a table to get past other guests to get to the food. Other than that it was really quite nice....

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Chris2709
Reviews.Content: Having booked twin rooms, we were given doubles. We were told that the hotel was full but they immediately found other rooms. One of them even had somebody else's luggage still in it. The rooms were appalling. Rotting decor, broken furniture, faulty plumbing. Reception and breakfast at number 28, so also out on a limb for staff.

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable!”
Reviews.Author: cadplan
Reviews.Content: It is a joke that Hotwire bills this hotel as a 3 star. It's not even a 2 star! Room was smaller than a prison cell and had NO Bathroom. Had to go down the hall to a community bathroom. Absolutely unacceptable! Customer service was dismal. It's location was the only redeeming factor. Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant accommodation worth the price paid for.”
Reviews.Author: Kevster79
Reviews.Content: I ignored previous reviews of this hotel even though they were not good at all. I decided to stay at the Belgravia Mews Hotel, London to see it for myself. I got quite a different feel. From the notice on the door it was clear the reception duties are run from the sister hotel a few doors along the street. The staff were very welcoming and friendly, and one nice touch was a receptionist walking me to my room. She also showed me my room to see that I am happy. That's not the customer service most hotels give. Usually you are just handed the key and told where to go. In my room I had to point out a stain on the carpet which they could of covered up, but apart from that, my room was immaculately clean. I had a thorough check. There were nice stylish curtains and a modern, comfortable bed. The bathroom was modern and with high quality complimentary toiletries. The only downside however is that the hotel seriously needs a lick of paint in all rooms. Plus new carpets wouldn't go a miss. Breakfast is also served in the sister hotel along the street. People staying in the Belgravia Mews were only allowed continental breakfast which didn't have any meats or cheeses to offer. The fact that the Belgravia Mews Hotel does not have itself a restaurant or reception makes it quite questionable why it's called a hotel and even more questionable to give themselves four stars! By using the sister hotel along the street, which is a high quality hotel, allows them to get away with that. Overall it was a very pleasant stay and not expensive considering the area.

Reviews.Title: “Never book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Coachonskis
Reviews.Content: What a disgrace this place is. Foul hotel. The shower didn't work ("oh, that's never happened before," says reception, but don't believe that for a moment). The shower sounded like a 2-stroke motorbike starting up, sure to wake up everyone else in the hotel. The WIFI didn't even exist. Even before going inside you have to dodge a leak coming down from above the entrance to the hotel: a tell tale sign that all is not well.

Reviews.Title: “avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: THN_DK
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night - worst hotel experience ever. Room (275 GBP pr. Night) was approx 5 sq.meters, dark and with stains on carpet. Bed so bad that I was unable to sleep in it. Had to move madras to floor in order to get any sleep. Recommendation: if this is your only option in London, then go to Victoria Station, take the Gatwick express to the airport and get an airport hotel (it only takes 30min with the train). Staying here, being unable to sleep spoiled my meetings next day - so essentially: Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointing”
Reviews.Author: HelloItsRachel
Reviews.Content: Booked via LateRooms on a "special deal" but I am glad this was a business rather than a pleasure weekend as it would have put a real dampener on any celebrations. Reception (in Tophams down the road) is very nice but once you have walked back down to no. 50 it is much less impressive. The foyer is dark and has a horrible odour (drains?). The room is small and the en suite even smaller. Although the accessories are nice (modern and stylish) the room was dirty and a bit battered. The bathroom light was hanging out it's socket and the shower drain pump was faulty causing a mini flood. The money spent on curtains and cushions would be better put towards cleaning and repairs. Oh well, lesson learned!

Reviews.Title: “A great disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: AntandTony
Reviews.Content: We booked a one night "special price" via laterooms.com. Double room with continental breakfast for Â£147. Not cheap. But the website looked good. What it does not say, however, is that the hotel is no more than an annex for another hotel 80/100 metres up Ebury Street. Reception is at Tophams hotel, as is the breakfast room. Not much fun if it is cold and wet. Our room was in a fusty basement. It was dark and artificial light was essential. Dark chocolate painted walls did not help. The shower had no door so water went everywhere, there was no shower gel, one of the ceiling lights was dangerously loose. The paint work was badly chipped in the bedroom, one light did not work, while another could only be switched on and off at the wall. There was NO information in the room about amenities, room service (promised on the website), cost of making calls, contact numbers.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling”
Reviews.Author: RichardN49
Reviews.Content: Booked Belgravia Mews for a special weekend break for a "significant birthday" treat for my wife. Cost Â£160 for a 4 star central London hotel. Oh my god! Belgravia Mews is an annexe without facilities. The room was grotty and smelt of poo. The corridor smelt of poo. The blonde who showed us the room had had a charisma bypass. I requested an immediate refund but was told this was not possible. I'm not normally the complaining sort but I threatened to inform Environmental Health if something wasn't done. Bingo - a transfer to the Knightsbridge Green hotel 10 minutes away. We were given a 2 bedroom penthouse which was recently refurbished. Cost me a taxi fare but what a relief. The only downside was that there was no breakfast provided at this hotel. This was included in the booking. I went back to the Belgravia Mews (reception is at Tophams Hotel) to ensure my Â£20 pre-authorisation was cancelled. Lo and behold, there was a lady customer at reception going nuts about them taking money from her account without permission. She threatened them with the police and was in tears. I can honestly say that all of the reception staff know about the shocking Belgravia Mews and one told me that she couldn't blame me for making a fuss. Another told my wife that the pics on their website bear no resemblance to the actual place. I am so angry and trading standards and environmental health will be informed.

Reviews.Title: “Not a disaster BUT not a relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: SCH007_11
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel - single room was small, but acceptable. Mattress on bed was cheap foam & poor quality (old?) which led to a bad night's sleep... if they sort this out it would be fine & a good budget option. I got a good, cheap deal, but don't pay anyway near the full price.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel at all costs, unless you're desperate”
Reviews.Author: mansamusa_001
Reviews.Content: Booked a night at this hotel at lastminute.com. First signs of trouble, they couldn't find my booking. Took the intervention of someone senior who i called on a mobile number they had listed for it to miraculosly reappear. The reception area is glitzy and looks nice, but don't be fooled. You'll actually be staying at No 50, which is a dump. Smelly carpet, leaky sewage, TV's not working. Double warning: They will ask you for a holding deposit for the room, which they'll pre authorise off your debit/credit card. Do not agree to this. You will not get that money back. They are counting on you either forgetting about it or not wanting to go through the hassle. Nice location, but the worst hotel ever. Avoid like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “False representation totally substandard!”
Reviews.Author: leopard_woman
Reviews.Content: We paid for the 4 star "tophams" hotel and they took us out the hotel to this dump few doors down! Could not believe it! Disgusting quality of service and room standard! There were no slacks on the bed which I found out the hard way as I fell through from just turning!!! Do not book either this or tophams! It is a lie!!!! Have written a complaint to them, last minute and trading standards! Stay away!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Polar Opposite Of Quality & Good Service”
Reviews.Author: BC1902
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a room which cost Â£94.00 per night at the Belgravia Mews Hotel for a colleague of mine who I sent out to a job at a nearby 5* London hotel. He checked in at around 14:20 on the afternoon of the 14/01/11 knowing that the next time he would see his room was after a 15 hour day of hard graft. When he got to his room he was extremely underwhelmed at how basic and mundane the room was, but didn't mind too much as he only had to sleep in it. Upon returning to his room some 15 hours later he discovered that there had been a leak and that there was water all over the floor. He notified reception who placed him in another room, which was also affected by the flood. He trekked back to reception, which was situated 3 buildings away and informed them of the problem in that room. They gave him a third key for another room which he found had clearly been vacated in the morning and not cleaned etc by room service. At approximately 05.10 in the morning he was eventually given a room that was not flooded or unmade but it was foul smelling and cold. However he was too tired and frustrated to do anything about it this time and decided to try and finally get some sleep. However the stench was too much and my colleague had to vacate his room at 06.15 and ended up having to upgrade his train ticket so that he could seek refuge in the First Class Lounge at Euston Train Station. Since then I have been desperately trying to obtain the manager of this hotel to lodge an official complaint and get a refund for the horrific night my colleague spent there. However, it seems that Mr Ali the hotel owner is constantly "on his break" or "in a meeting" or "off sick". I have emailed the complaints email address and called everyday since to no avail. I would never book this hotel every again nor any of his other hotels such as the Topham Hotel in London. Nor would I ever recommend this place to anyone else. It is not suitable to board dogs in let alone people.

Reviews.Title: “This Place is a Dump”
Reviews.Author: Titchd
Reviews.Content: This repulsive place will ruin your night in London. (You can see how strongly i feel about this dump). The carpets, which cover the room and hallways, are so stained and dirty, you dare not walk on the them barefoot; the rooms are of course, tiny (this being London), but smelled awful and offered no climate control. Used blankets were thrown, unwashed and unfolded, into the closet, the phone didn't work, and the service was entirely indifferent. Simply the worst place of dozens London hotels I've stayed in. The only "plus" is that it is very close to Victoria Station. Please don't even consider this as a last resort.

Reviews.Title: “arab nightmare”
Reviews.Author: jozefszwejk
Reviews.Content: - no reception, - no service - no lift - no internet (web acess in all rooms - liars) - no brakfest - look at backyard (city view - liars) - event no enough light in the room One one small star for kettle in room. PS It was warm, if you pay 124 punds for a night is it important

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MrsM3
Reviews.Content: Absolutely awful. Unhelpful staff, appalling service. Communal areas smell. Rooms are tiny and not particularly clean. There are plenty of other hotels that offer a much better service and much better rooms. So overpriced its ridiculous. Not a good word to say about this hotel at all. Would not stay here again and definitely would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “HELL”
Reviews.Author: handie1406
Reviews.Content: connected to Tophams the 2 rooms were disgusting I do not normally write on these sites but the standard of hotel and rooms were terrible complaints were told to be addressed by e mail ruined my other halfs chilled 2 days out before Christmast fire doors pinned open by the fire !! foul smelling hall ways GUES what DONT stay there

Reviews.Title: “FROM 'BOUTIQUE' TO 'BASEMENT' or WHERE NOT TO STAY IN BELGRAVIA”
Reviews.Author: tresco2
Reviews.Content: We arrived at what we thought was Belgravia Mews Hotel (advertised as ' luxury boutique 4* hotel!) which turned out to be under the auspices of Tophams 100 yards down the road. We finally gained entry to our 'room' at 4 pm - four and a half hours later than promised.. The ensuite facilities were a complete joke; imagine an aircraft toilet with a shower in the corner, rusty and mildewed with the 'shower' hanging, no water appeared through it, no plug in the basin, no toilet roll holder, nowhere to put anything; the only redeeming factor was that the water (in the basin) was hot - what a pity we couldn't use it! Only 1 coathanger in the wardrobe; no hairdryer; the lighting was so dim that I actually had to use a torch to read instructions on the room heater; I tried to ring Reception and was transferred to the Harcourt Hotel (??) who didn't answer anyway. I was so angry that I walked to Reception and let rip at the almost non-english speaking staff - none of whom seemed to have any idea of what was expected of them. We were attending an important dinner and arrived hot, bothered, unwashed and furious. Although the cleaning staff seemed to do their best, the whole building was tatty - and in parts almost derelict. My biggest concern however, was lack of safety particularly in the case of fire. No fire escape to be seen, no apparent instructions on what to do in the case of fire. Unfortunately we were booked in for 2 nights and had paid in advance. We were moved to a room on the first floor for the 2nd night which was a slight improvement and had a working shower with plenty of hot water., but I would never ever recommend this place to anyone. I can't believe that we paid Â£260 for what turned out to be a miserable, upsetting experience. I am ashamed to be British if this is what we offer tourists and visitors to our country.

Reviews.Title: “Needs not plugged! Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: SWO1977
Reviews.Content: Where to start! Lets try a positive! - Its close to victoria station with several eateries in the local area! HOWEVER, (if you want to be clean when you use them though, dont stay here!!!!) On finding the Hotel we found our reception was actually in another hotel 100 yards down the road! When eventually we were booked in we were shown to our room. Not happy having to lug heavy bags around at this point! On entry to the room we found an empty water bottle from the previous occupants, some form of stain on the carpet, facilities for 1, even though we had booked for 2!!! The only light was from bad side lights, (No main light in the room!) The double bed looked ok and was comfortable but due to the rest of the room been how it was it made you doubt how clean it really was! The bathroom was dirty, really smelly (stail and stagnant water!) very small with rusty fittings, the shower fitting was smashed and so the shower head was just hanging down the wall, the toilet roll holder was also broken with the toilet roll thrown on the sink and to top it off no plug for the sink! When we approached the reception we were told they didnt have any other rooms and they didnt keep spare plugs and so there was nothing they could do!!!!!!!! The staff seemed and were very disinterested in our custom and very unhelpful. The point in us being there was for a theatre trip, (which was close by - another positive!) but we effectively had to go to dinner and the show feeling basically unclean and a little jadded after a day's travelling due to the state of the room, bathroom and the fact that we didnt have a plug. Not a happy camper in the slightest, but you do live and learn! My advice to you, Dont even take the risk!

Reviews.Title: “This was a complete joke at Â£260 and the worst indictment of London's rip off hotel industry”
Reviews.Author: KateWLondon
Reviews.Content: Granted I booked this at the last minute as work commitments meant I needed an extra night in London and granted it is one of London's busiest week. but nothing can excuse the complete rip off this room represented. A camp bed in a small hot room with no proper lighting, stained walls, worn carpet, a kettle that didn't work, a reception that didn't respond and a shower room that one couldn't even turn around does not represent value for money at Â£260! The rate on the check in slip i saw quoted Â£165 - a rip off even at that amount and I am at a loss to understand how lastminute.com could justify the Â£100 hike to Â£260 plus. I couldn't check out quick enough this enough and when I did and spoke to the manager on the desk early this morning he was not familiar with the room and made some excuse about problems with bookings.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you just need a place to sleep in a good location”
Reviews.Author: NSTARKMichigan
Reviews.Content: To be fair, I had an excellent rate 62 pounds a night and it was a great location (near Victoria Station and close to many sights). The room itself was also ok -- furnishings were decent and the bed was reasonably comfortable. If you need more than a bed, however, look elsewhere. I was there for business and booked because it was in the location I needed and supposedly had free wireless in all the rooms. Turns out -- no internet in my room, no working phone, no working television. I was trying to figure out one of the lamps when I finally realized it didn't have a light bulb. Customer service was pretty terrible - they weren't rude necessarily, just really (almost laughably) incompetent. My friend tried to contact me and they just never picked up the phone.

Reviews.Title: “Frankly disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Arald
Reviews.Content: It is incomprehensible how the Belgravia Mews can claim to have 4 stars, describing itself on its homepage as "boutique styled" and saying that what they offer is "luxury accommodation". Staff not really interested, or helpful. Cleaning clearly unsatisfactory : The place was dirty - stains on the bedspread; you could write your name in the dust on the television shelf. No remote control for the TV, and athough the girl at the reception (situated in the neighbouring Topham's Hotel) said one would be brought to my room, this was not done. Tea-coffee tray not replenished. No hairdryer to be seen. No telephone in the room, Ther hotel is conveniently situated, and I suppose the bed itself was OK, but all in all - frankly disappointing, and overpriced for the standard offered. I shall certainly not return, and would not recommend this hotel to anyone. MDM

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Money”
Reviews.Author: sladefunk
Reviews.Content: Great value for money hotel. Ideal for short theatre breaks etc which is what we did. Great location in a nice part of London very close to Victoria Station. Staff and management were very friendly and dealt with all our needs. Would recommend to couples wanting to visit London.

Reviews.Title: “4* Faux Pas”
Reviews.Author: PerkyPensioners
Reviews.Content: The public places of the premises were quite tidy, but had unpainted doors which gave the appearance that maintenance work was still underway. This was substantiated by the surroundings outside our room where there was a huge expanse of ceiling that was hanging down which was full of mould. My husband suffers with asthma and I was worried that this may instigate an attack. After leaving the house at 6.30am that morning, and enduring a tiring coach journey, we were ready to have a wash and change on arrival. Unfortunately we could not do this as there were no toiletries. I had not taken my own as this has never been a necessity in any hotel I have stayed in, particularly a 4* hotel. Also following a long journey, we were ready for a cup of tea â€“ the hotel was advertised as having â€˜tea and coffee making facilitiesâ€™. Unfortunately this also was not possible as there were no provisions, and had there been, we would have had to make drinks separately as there was only one cup. I tried to use the internal phone, pressing two buttons that showed â€˜Receptionâ€™ and â€˜Porterâ€™ without success. The phone rang but no one answered. Eventually a message said the call was being transferred, but still no one answered. I looked on my booking confirmation for the land line number and again rang the hotel, but there was still no answer. We went back down the road to the Tophams Hotel, noting on route the telephone number on the plaque outside the premises of 50 Ebury Street to check we were dialling the correct number, which we were. At the Tophams Hotel we notified the receptionist of the lack of provisions, and she promised to send someone up with the necessary items. We returned and waited but no one arrived. We then left the premises and went to a nearby cafÃ© for a drink, then went out for the day, expecting that the room would be replenished on our return. We returned to our room 5 hours later, tired and in need of a shower and a hot drink, but still no one had dealt with our request. We also discovered that we had no toilet paper. We had to go back to a local cafÃ© for a drink, and then on to Victoria to buy provisions to enable us to wash etc. In addition to the inconveniences outlined above, there were further problems. The tap over the bathroom sink was loose. The tap was also far too large for the sink, and poorly positioned so that even when we had finally bought our own soap, it was almost impossible to wash as we could not get close to the sink bowl. Also the handle to the bathroom door was loose, and had there been only one person staying in the room, there would have been a great danger of being locked in the bathroom without means of escape. The light in the bathroom flickered continuously which was very uncomfortable visually. We checked out of the hotel about 10.30am the following day â€“ our supplies had still not arrived. Whilst dealing with another client; the receptionist asked our name, and without showing courtesy to ourselves or this client, she waved a piece of paper at us which was the receipt for our stay at the hotel. I explained that I was not happy with my stay and requested a refund. The receptionist told me that she could not help and that I needed to speak to the manager. Unfortunately the manager was not in the hotel, and not expected back until after we had left London. The whole experience was totally unacceptable. The premises of 50 Ebury Street are merely a set of rooms and cannot even be considered a â€˜hotelâ€™, let alone a 4* hotel. I have written to complain and am waiting a reply.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE - Outrageous Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Oreland-Don
Reviews.Content: Outrageous Customer Service Do not stays at the Harcourt House, Tophams, Belgravia Mews, or Parklane Mews - all owned by the same group. I booked a room at Harcourt House on Oct 15th, 2009 and received an email confirmation on Oct 16th for three nights at 90 GBP each night. Upon check in seven days later the reception proceeded to tell me the rate was recently changed for Sat night to 139 GBP. She told me that Harcourt was recently bought out in the last few weeks and the rate was changed. Even though I had a confirmation from just seven days earlier she refused to accept it. She basically stonewalled me with the following statements: well we are not changing the other two nights.... I don't have responsibility to revise the rate.... there is no manager on duty... I can't provide his phone number. So as it was ten o'clock at night, I requested to have a manger call me the next day - no call. This person had no customer service skills, compassion, nor did she attempt to apologize. Her tone and body language was take it or leave it. I did email upon my return, had a back and forth. Their logic was even more outrageous. Read some other reviews for Tophams, they are very consistent.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: SBWilloughby
Reviews.Content: My work booked me into the Harcourt House Hotel for a week, and it was the weirdest, most useless hotel room. There was no fridge, and just soup from room service cost Â£12, so I had to keep buying crackers and pre-made sandwiches from Sainsburys every night. There was no table in the room, save for one tiny upended cinder block that was supposed to be a bedside table. The mattress was about as thick as a gym mat, and the sheet that was on it wasn't fitted, and also didn't technically even fit. You could not wash your hair in the shower without opening the shower door so you could extend your arm. The toilet seat wasn't attached properly, so every time you sat on it, it slid off to the side. The wifi cost Â£5. The sink leaked all over the floor even if turned on just long enough to wash your hands. The only mirror was behind the toilet. I could go on and on. The room was also tiny and dark and in the basement, with one window, and painted chocolate brown, so it was like living in a cave. And you couldn't keep the window open because it opened onto the garden area of the suite next door. The walls were paper thin. I could hear the staff arguing as well as other people's phone conversations and televisions. The only upside was that the tiny shower had really good water pressure, and it was close to Victoria Station. I've stayed in much nicer hotels in London for the same amount of money. I'd never stay here again. I should add: I stayed there AFTER it was under its new management.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Bed in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Cascol
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just left there today and I think it was perfect for our first time to London. Being so close to Victoria train and coach station is so convenient and as another reviewer said, if you were planning on seeing Wicked or Billy Elliott, then this really is the best place to stay. Only 2 stops from Oxford St in Soho which is convenient too. When we arrived the room allocated to us was undergoing "maintenance" and therefore we had to be in the basement room, which was not a problem at all as we didn't plan on spending much time in the room, however because we were in the basement, the free wifi didn't work which is my only negative comment. Comfortable bed, clean room, hot shower, all that I'm asking for and Harcourt achieved it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cats_123
Reviews.Content: an unobtrusive small hotel just off the main drag next to Victoria, but on a quiet side street. Room tastefully furnished and a really comfortable kingsize bed!!!! Breakfast included in price was brought to the room at requested time. (Croissants, toast, yoghurt, fruit.....). Check in around 14:30 but hotel will look after suitcases. Very good value for money - highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Harcourt - great price, good location”
Reviews.Author: Manilowmad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harcourt as we were looking for a reasonably priced room for a one night stay in London. The hotel was a great find - one night for Â£79. The hotel is located in a quiet road, yet only five minutes walk from Victoria train and coach station. If you were intending to see Wicked or BIlly Elliott you could not be more perfectly placed. The room was newly refurbished and the bed very comfortable. On the down-side was the tiny bathroom, it was smaller than our wardrobe at home! Apart from that a lovely stay and continental breakfast in bed to boot!!

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly, clean, quiet and good value”
Reviews.Author: stevetathome
Reviews.Content: I think this place must now be under new ownership because I don't recognise the place from the reviews here. This is basic but good value, clean, friendly accommodation in a nice quiet street just a few minutes walk from Victoria station/tube. I stayed here in a twin room with my 6 year old daughter for 2 days. Continental breakfast served in the room was fresh e.g toast, crossants still warm, plentiful and varied. Our room had a modern bathroom and a simply decorated room. Beds comfy too. Staff nice and friendly. When I'm back in town I'd certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Victoria Station”
Reviews.Author: Hot-Sauce-50
Reviews.Content: I booked as the Harcourt is an easy walk from Victoria Station. An initial booking problem via a well known website, which the receptionist was unable to deal with, with was amicably resolved when the manager arrived 20 minutes later and I was given a ground floor double room. The room was recently refurbished - smart, clean and tidy - although the lighting was a little dim. Toiletries, Tea/Coffee facilities and Freeview flatscreen TV were fine I did not have breakfast as I had to leave before 8am - but theres a super cafe on the way to the station open from 6am. Bed was comfortable and I had an undisturbed nights sleep. A compact and bijou en-suite was ample for a one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “New ownership at Harcourt House”
Reviews.Author: SeniorTraveler3
Reviews.Content: We were booked into Harcourt house for a four night stay in London. We have used this hotel on two previous occasions because of its convenient location close to Victoria Station. It offered overnight accommodation along with a full breakfast and a friendly staff; the rooms were small but adequate for a short stay. From the web site it appeared that the same services were offered so we reserved rooms for three people. The surprise started upon our arrival. This B and B is under new ownership. The building is being renovated and staff consisted of one helpful but overworked person. The cooked breakfast was gone, instant coffee and rolls were delivered to the room. The entire building smelled of paint and other building materials. The rooms were clean and the beds were new but the remodeling turned small rooms into miniscule ones. We had room number two which has a double bed but the bathroom looks like something out of an RV with a combination shower and toilet with a one foot high step up. This would be acceptable for a camper but not for a hotel. The original room on offer for three people consisted of a small room with a double bed and a couch with no bedding. This was not acceptable so we changed to two double rooms for one night. There being no way to escape the paint fumes and the general level of discomfort we decided to move on. We found comfortable rooms at Tophams which is close by on the same street. Their friendly staff even came and helped move our luggage.

Reviews.Title: “nothing special”
Reviews.Author: gambler78
Reviews.Content: I'm a bit disappointed about my visit at harcourt hotel, it is well located and it is safe, but there have been some things I didn't like: breakfast was only from 7.30 to 8.30, too early!! At the moment of booking, I had asked for two rooms, five persons, and they told me that there were only two double rooms for four persons and one double room for one, I accepted but when I arrived to the hotel I realized that one double room had three beds, one double and one single.. absurd, especially because three rooms have costed more than two. Moreover, the furniture of the hotel is very old, maybe it's a typical english style, but I haven't had a good impression.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Harcourt House”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous789
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked into Harcourt House in October 2007 and stayed only one night. The room did not meet our expectations so we found another hotel for the remainder of our stay in London. The room was very dingy/dirty and located behind the steps beside the door to go the basement where the breakfast was served. I tried to take a shower but nearly flooded the small bathroom as the shower did not drain. My wife did not even attempt to take a shower as she said she may have felt dirtier after taking a shower as nothing in the room was clean. The toilet was in a separate very small room which unfortunately doubled as a storage closet for cleaning supplies for the hotel. Overall it was quite a miserable experience. We didn't even stay for breakfast the next morning as we really did not want to be there. I most certainly would not recommend Harcourt House to anyone and I'm quite disappointed my wife and I had to spend a night there on our honeymoon. Furthermore, I feel the B&B was misrepresented on the website even though it appeared to have somewhat decent reviews. Never-the-less, a photograph of our particular room I'm sure was never displayed as a selling point. Perhaps the rooms upstairs are better. Without raising too much fuss, I simply told the concierge at the hotel the day we checked in we were checking out either immediately or the next morning and she preferred the next morning and unfortunately we agreed. Looking back, I should have left immediately as the hotel was clearly not as advertised.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: nonnajean
Reviews.Content: Great location near Victoria coach, train and tube stations. Several good restaurants close. Actually backs up to Margaret Thatcher's home in Belgravia. Long climb to 3rd floor room, but actually no problem for this 77 year old, but a bit hard to get the suitcase up. Everything worked and was clean. Good full breakfast if desired. Definitely would use again and recommend to friends who like reasonably priced B&B's.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine”
Reviews.Author: HarryfromLA
Reviews.Content: I chose the Harcourt Hotel based on its price, its inclusion in Rick Steves and the fact that the TripAdvisor reviews were decent. My one night there met my expectation. At 85 pounds, it wasn't cheap but it was a bargain compared to other places in London. The location on an attractive street close to Victoria Station is extremely convenient. I got in late an was surprised that there weren't more restaurants and places open outside of the train station. I had to walk up a few flights of stairs to my room which wasn't a problem for me but could be for others. When I walked inside I was pleasantly surprised by the acommodations - clean and not tiny with a satisfactory bathroom, though the shower was typically small. Compared to the two star budget hotels I stayed at in Paris and Rome, the whole experience was a cut below but not much. Breakfast was included and was not bad - poached eggs with ham and fruit and bread. The staff was satisfactory. In total, I wasn't looking for much and the Harcourt Hotel served my needs just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: marilynvan
Reviews.Content: I was a little disappointed in Harcourt. The hosts were not very friendly & didn't seem to be around to help with any questions. The breakfast was average, but they did not let us order scrambled eggs. When we asked we were told they had prepared poached. The tomatoes were canned with thick sauce on top & the sausage was tasteless. No wash cloths in bath. The new drapes could not be closed at night. Would not choose it again even though it is very near Victoria Station, its main redeeming quality.

HotelInfo.Name: Belgravia Mews
HotelInfo.Address: 50 Ebury Street, London SW1W 0LU, England
